intro: Conicosia pugioniformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conicosia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Conicosia pugioniformis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
